QtScrcpy is a lightweight, high-performance application for displaying and controlling Android devices on your computer via USB or network. It requires no root access and supports Windows, macOS, and Linux, offering low latency and fast startup times.

Weathr is a command-line interface (CLI) application written in Rust that displays real-time weather information directly in the terminal. It features animated ASCII art for various weather conditions, auto-location detection, and customizable display options.

Browserless is a Dockerized headless browser solution that allows users to deploy and manage Chrome, Firefox, or Webkit instances for automated tasks. It supports integration with Puppeteer and Playwright, offering features like parallelism, a debug viewer, and configurable timeouts, and can be run locally or used via their cloud service.

SpotiFLAC is a desktop application that allows users to download Spotify tracks in high-quality FLAC format. It sources audio from alternative streaming services like Tidal, Qobuz, and Amazon Music without requiring any user accounts or authentication with Spotify.

CompressO is a cross-platform desktop application built with Tauri and Rust that allows users to significantly reduce video file sizes. It leverages FFmpeg for powerful video compression and offers a user-friendly interface for offline video conversion.
